April 2022 County of Marin EMS 5700
EMS DISTRIBUTION OF
NALOXONE KITS
Purpose
• To oversee the “leave behind” Narcan program which allows emergency medical responders to
distribute “leave behind” naloxone (Narcan) kits at the scene of an overdose or perceived
overdose
Policy
A. EMS provider logistics staff will receive naloxone kits intended for laypersons use, as they
are available from external suppliers
B. Naloxone kits will be distributed to EMS providers in a manner similar to current supply chain
procedures
C. EMS providers will distribute “leave behind” Narcan kits at the scene of an overdose, or upon
their discretion, will give a naloxone kit to any person encountered on an EMS call that is at
risk of experiencing an opiate overdose (e.g. a current opiate overdose patient who refuses
transport) or any person in position to assist a person at risk of opiate overdose
D. Shall not give naloxone to patients or bystanders from the regular EMS patient care supply
E. Resupply provider’s naloxone kits, as stock is available, via usual supply chain procedures. It
may be the case that no resupply is available; layperson naloxone kits are not a required in-
service medication
